verses.kjv: Call now, if there be any that will answer thee; and to which of the saints wilt thou turn?
verses.ct: Go ahead — call out! Is anyone going to respond to you? Which of the holy ones will you turn to for help?

verses.kjv: For wrath killeth the foolish man, and envy slayeth the silly one.
verses.ct: Resentment kills the foolish person, and jealousy destroys the gullible one.

verses.kjv: I have seen the foolish taking root: but suddenly I cursed his habitation.
verses.ct: I've watched fools appear to be thriving, but suddenly their homes were cursed.

verses.kjv: His children are far from safety, and they are crushed in the gate, neither is there any to deliver them.
verses.ct: Their children have no safety. They are crushed in the courts with no one to rescue them.

verses.kjv: Whose harvest the hungry eateth up, and taketh it even out of the thorns, and the robber swalloweth up their substance.
verses.ct: The hungry devour their harvest, taking it even from among the thorns, and thieves swallow up their wealth.

verses.kjv: Although affliction cometh not forth of the dust, neither doth trouble spring out of the ground;
verses.ct: Suffering doesn't just spring up from the dirt, and trouble doesn't sprout from the ground.

verses.kjv: Yet man is born unto trouble, as the sparks fly upward.
verses.ct: But human beings are born into trouble just as surely as sparks rise upward.

verses.kjv: I would seek unto God, and unto God would I commit my cause:
verses.ct: If I were you, I would appeal to God and present my case to him.

verses.kjv: Which doeth great things and unsearchable; marvellous things without number:
verses.ct: He does great things beyond understanding — amazing things too many to count.

verses.kjv: Who giveth rain upon the earth, and sendeth waters upon the fields:
verses.ct: He sends rain on the earth and pours water on the fields.

verses.kjv: To set up on high those that be low; that those which mourn may be exalted to safety.
verses.ct: He lifts up those who are lowly, and those who grieve are raised to a place of security.

verses.kjv: He disappointeth the devices of the crafty, so that their hands cannot perform their enterprise.
verses.ct: He frustrates the schemes of the cunning so that their hands can't carry out their plans.

verses.kjv: He taketh the wise in their own craftiness: and the counsel of the froward is carried headlong.
verses.ct: He traps the clever in their own tricks, and the plots of the devious collapse on them.

verses.kjv: They meet with darkness in the day time, and grope in the noonday as in the night.
verses.ct: They stumble into darkness in broad daylight and fumble around at noon as if it were midnight.

verses.kjv: But he saveth the poor from the sword, from their mouth, and from the hand of the mighty.
verses.ct: But he rescues the poor from the sword, from their cutting words, and from the grip of the powerful.

verses.kjv: So the poor hath hope, and iniquity stoppeth her mouth.
verses.ct: So the needy have hope, and injustice shuts its mouth.

verses.kjv: Behold, happy is the man whom God correcteth: therefore despise not thou the chastening of the Almighty:
verses.ct: Pay attention — the person God corrects is truly fortunate. So don't reject the discipline of the Almighty.

verses.kjv: For he maketh sore, and bindeth up: he woundeth, and his hands make whole.
verses.ct: He wounds, but he also bandages. He injures, but his hands also heal.

verses.kjv: He shall deliver thee in six troubles: yea, in seven there shall no evil touch thee.
verses.ct: He will rescue you from 6 disasters — yes, in 7, no harm will reach you.

verses.kjv: In famine he shall redeem thee from death: and in war from the power of the sword.
verses.ct: During famine he will save you from death, and in war he will protect you from the sword's power.

verses.kjv: Thou shalt be hid from the scourge of the tongue: neither shalt thou be afraid of destruction when it cometh.
verses.ct: You will be shielded from the lash of vicious talk, and you won't need to dread destruction when it arrives.

verses.kjv: At destruction and famine thou shalt laugh: neither shalt thou be afraid of the beasts of the earth.
verses.ct: You will laugh at devastation and hunger, and you won't need to be afraid of wild animals.

verses.kjv: For thou shalt be in league with the stones of the field: and the beasts of the field shall be at peace with thee.
verses.ct: The stones in your fields won't hinder you, and the wild animals will be at peace with you.

verses.kjv: And thou shalt know that thy tabernacle shall be in peace; and thou shalt visit thy habitation, and shalt not sin.
verses.ct: You will know that your home is secure. When you inspect your property, nothing will be missing.

verses.kjv: Thou shalt know also that thy seed shall be great, and thine offspring as the grass of the earth.
verses.ct: You will also know that your descendants will be many — your offspring as numerous as the grass of the earth.

verses.kjv: Thou shalt come to thy grave in a full age, like as a shock of corn cometh in in his season.
verses.ct: You will reach your grave at a ripe old age, like a sheaf of grain gathered at just the right time.

verses.kjv: Lo this, we have searched it, so it is; hear it, and know thou it for thy good.
verses.ct: We have carefully examined all of this, and it is true. Listen to it and take it to heart for your own good.
